Sentencas: A general electrode-electrolyte-assembly (EEA) model has been developed, which is valid for different designs of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) operating at different temperatures.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, it is applied to analyze the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported SOFCs.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: One of the novel features of the present model is its treatment of electrodes.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An electrode in the present model is composed of two distinct layers referred to as the backing layer and the reaction zone layer.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The other important feature of the present model is its flexibility in fuel, having taking into account the reforming and water-gas shift reactions in the anode.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The coupled governing equations of species, charge and energy along with the constitutive equations in different layers of the cell are solved using finite volume method.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model can predict all forms of overpotentials and the predicted concentration overpotential is validated with measured data available in literature.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is found that in an anode-supported SOFC, the cathode overpotential is still the largest cell potential loss mechanism, followed by the anode overpotential at low current densities; however, the anode overpotential becomes dominant at high current densities.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The cathode and electrolyte overpotentials are not negligible even though their thicknesses are negligible relative to the anode thickness.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Even at low fuel utilizations, the anode concentration overpotential becomes significant when chemical reactions (reforming and water-gas shift) in the anode are not considered.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A parametric study has also been carried out to examine the effect of various key operating and design parameters on the performance of an anode-supported planar SOFCs.
Titulo: A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells
A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells
A general electrolyte-electrode-assembly model for the performance characteristics of planar anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells
